dkeep.logic

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Character
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Guard, Hero, Ogre

    public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has basic information about the in-game characters such as the hero, guards and ogres.
    See Also:
    Hero, Guard, Ogre

        the weapon's display char

      • hasWeapon

        public boolean hasWeapon()
        Returns a boolean value that is true if the character owns a weapon and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        boolean value that indicates if the character owns a weapon

      • setWeapon

        public void setWeapon(boolean value)
        Sets the character's 'weapon' attribute to 'value'. The 'weapon' attribute indicates if the character owns a weapon.
        Parameters:
        value - the boolean value that 'weapon' will be set to

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Returns the character's X value.
        Returns:
        the character's X value

        Sets the character's X value to the x parameter.
        Parameters:
        x - value to set X to

        public int getY()
        Returns the character's Y value.

        the character's Y value

      • getDisplayChar

        public char getDisplayChar()
        Returns the char that is used to represent the character.
        Returns:
        the character's display char

      • setDisplayChar

        public void setDisplayChar(char value)
        Sets the character's display char to the value parameter.
        Parameters:
        value - the char that will be set as the character's display char

      • move

        public abstract void move(char[][] table)
        Abstract method that is responsible for moving a character in the level's table.
        Parameters:
        table - char matrix that represents the level's table.
        See Also:
        Level, Guard, Ogre

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition(int direction)
        Method to update the character's position. The direction parameter has four possible values: 2 means down, 4 means left, 6 means right and 8 means up.
        Parameters:
        direction - integer value that indicates where the character will move to

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int X,
                        int Y)
        Sets the character's position to the X and Y parameters.
        Parameters:
        X - value to set the character's X to
        Y - value to set the character's Y to

      • isAdjacent

        public abstract boolean isAdjacent(int X,
                                   int Y)
        Abstract method that returns true if the character's position is adjacent to the (X,Y) position and returns false otherwise. This is an abstract method because this function's behavior is different for hero, guards and ogres.
        Parameters:
        X - x value of the desired position
        Y - y value of the desired position
        See Also:
        Hero, Guard, Ogre

      • isStunned

        public boolean isStunned()
        Returns a boolean value that is true if the character is stunned and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        boolean value that indicates if the character is stunned

      • setStunned

        public abstract void setStunned(boolean value)
        Abstract method that sets the character's 'stunned' attribute to 'value'. The 'stunned' attribute indicates if the character is stunned.
        Parameters:
        value - the boolean value that 'stunned' will be set to
        See Also:
        Ogre

      • getTurnsStunned

        public int getTurnsStunned()
        Returns the numbers of turns the character is stunned for.
        Returns:
        numbers of turns the character is stunned for

      • setTurnsStunned

        public void setTurnsStunned(int turnsStunned)
        Sets the numbers of turns the character will be stunned for.
        Parameters:
        turnsStunned - value to set the numbers of turns the character will be stunned for

      • setWeaponX

        public void setWeaponX(int weaponX)
        Sets the x value of the character's weapon to the weaponX parameter.
        Parameters:
        weaponX - value to set the weapon's x coordinate to

      • setWeaponY

        public void setWeaponY(int weaponY)
        Sets the y value of the character's weapon to the weaponY parameter.
        Parameters:
        weaponY - value to set the weapon's y coordinate to
